sub_title: Senior Lecturer Analytical Chemistry at Hogeschool Utrecht (University of Applied Sciences Utrecht)
summary: Making sustainable contributions to society is my motivator and will drive my career. I sincerely believe that global society has to change its mind and habits to keep a positive prospect to a sustainable future, for which I want to contribute via my professional work in Chemistry and Life Sciences. At present, my contribution will be teaching young adults in becoming responsible professionals with a critical mind in the areas of Chemistry and Life Sciences, with focus on Analytical Chemistry as my professional expertise.

My main responsibility is focused on the "external projects", for which I maintain and acquire the contacts between companies/research institutes and Hogeschool Utrecht for research opportunities. Students perform analytical experiments year round, to solve clients research questions, executed in small student groups tutored by lecturers analytical chemistry. I coordinate and support these projects with my 20+ years knowledge of analytical chemistry.

As well as, as a Senior Lecturer Chemistry I teach young adults (17-25 years old) to become young professionals in the field of Chemistry (Bachelor of Applied Sciences, BSc). Job description is a combination of teaching theoretical classes/courses (focus on Analytical Chemistry subjects), training laboratory skills, tutoring projects and supervising minors and final exam traineeships from 1st year through 4th year students.

Co-promotors: Dr. Eduard Struys & Dr. Gajja Salomons

Metabolic Unit, Department of Clinical Chemistry

One of the VUmc Metabolic Unitâs research lines is the study of rare inherited neurometabolic disorders. The diseases 2-hydroxyglutaric acidurias were the subject of my PhD-thesis. The cause/origin, therapeutic intervention and progression of these disorders were investigated in a multidisciplinary setting of metabolic, enzymatic, genetic and clinical disciplines. My role as an scientist with an analytical chemical background was to execute (bio)chemical experiments/analyses, to manage the research progress and publish the results in scientific publications.

Job characteristics:
âº Designing and executing analytical/(bio)chemical experiments for metabolic and enzymatic studies (e.g. LC-MS/MS method development, enzyme assays, patient diagnoses, human cell culture).
âº Managing research results from metabolic, enzymatic, genetic and clinical studies in a well structured manner (MS Office 2007 Access-database).
âº Publishing scientific results in international journals (see details below).
âº Training, supporting and supervising students and technicians in their laboratory work, projects and BSc/MSc-research theses.', 'title': 'PhD-student Inborn Errors of Metabolism (MSc)', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 139358, 'name': 'Acrux', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C510BAQGiyWqA_0awYQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1519918619237?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=2pUbtMDb3kH8qlcSyqf20dQylWcUTDJ9dXvuj6kRB7Y', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/acrux/', 'employees': {'start': 11, 'end': 50}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Melbourne, Australia', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}}, 'company': 'Acrux', 'description': 'Department of Analytical Development
